title: “Monty Python and the Holy Grail” subtitles
content:
Can anyone recognize the font used for subtitles in this old Nordic epic _Mønti Pythøn ik den Hølie Gräilen_?

Font: 

 Granby Condensed 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145241/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Monty Python and the Holy Grail - opening credits - subs.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145241/http:/typophile.com/files/Monty%20Python%20and%20the%20Holy%20Grail%20-%20opening%20credits%20-%20subs.png) | 483.18 KB |
author: inktrap

comments.content:
Looks like Granby Condensed, Stephenson Blake 1930. No digital. Was aka Art Grotesque. Reference Jaspert Encyclopaedia of Type 1970 p 285.  
Don

You could make a rough approximation by condensing a digital Granby [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/granby/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145241/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/granby/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/granby/") or [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/granby-sb/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145241/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/granby-sb/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/granby-sb/")  
Don
